title: Add Two Numbers
description: Given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers in reverse digit order, return their sum as a new linked list also in reverse order.

approaches.description: Convert both lists to integer values, add them, and then convert the result back to a linked list.
steps: Traverse each linked list to reconstruct the integer (in reverse order).
Convert the resulting integer back into a linked list by extracting digits in reverse order.

approaches.description: Traverse both lists while summing corresponding digits and maintaining carry.
steps: Initialize a dummy node and a carry variable (0).
Traverse both lists simultaneously, summing the digits and the carry.
Create new node for each digit of the result and append to result list.
Move to the next nodes in both lists.
If carry remains after traversal, append it as a new node.

notes.linked_list_order: Each digit is stored in reverse order; the head node is the least significant digit.
notes.carry_handling: Don't forget to include a carry node if the last sum generates it.

hints: You don’t need to convert the entire list to an integer.
Use a dummy node to simplify the addition logic.
Use a carry variable for handling sums ≥ 10.
follow_up: What if the numbers are represented in forward order?
Can you solve it recursively instead of iteratively?
How would you handle negative numbers or subtraction?
